message.content:
cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses a crowdsourcing system for building hierarchies of concepts, which involves human-computer interaction and artificial intelligence techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also mentions the use of information gain criterion, which is a common technique in machine learning and artificial intelligence, suggesting that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another likely sub-category. The paper deals with semantic relationships among concepts, which is a topic in natural language processing, making cs.CL (Computation and Language) another possible sub-category. The paper also discusses the cost-effectiveness of the proposed system, which is relevant to the sub-category cs.CY (Computers and Society). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed methodology on simulated data and real-world application domains, which suggests that cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is another possible sub-category.
